intro: Matthiola longipetala subsp. hirta, commonly known as the hairy stock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its hairy foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value and ease of cultivation have made it a popular choice among gardeners.
